channel.title: Cant get ::npc to work? please help!
channel.description: well guys this is my npc command I found [code] } else if (cmd[0].equals("npc")) { Server.engine.newNPC(Integer.parseInt(cmd[1]), p.absX, p.absY, p.heightLevel, p.absX + 1, p.absY + 1, p.absX + -1, p.absY + -1, false);[/code] but when i compile it, it says theres an error with the period after Server.engine"."newNPC the dot in quotations is the one i get a problem with, so if someone could leave their help or a better ::npc command, that would b GREATLY appreciated

item.title: Cant get ::npc to work? please help!
item.dc:creator: @jamessemple jamessemple
item.description:
@jamessemple wrote:

no i tested it on mine and it comes up with errors in compiler saying

cannot find symbol;
server.npchandler.spawnANPC

Read full topic
item.source: Cant get ::npc to work? please help!

item.title: Cant get ::npc to work? please help!
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“jamessemple, post:4, topic:305848”][quote author=Mod Franklin link=topic=402063.msg2979848#msg2979848 date=1254541414]
Try This

if (command.startsWith("npc") && playerRights >= 3) { try { int newNPC = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(4)); if (newNPC >= 0) { server.npcHandler.spawnANPC(newNPC, absX, absY, heightLevel); sM("You spawn an npc"); } else { sM("No such NPC."); } } catch(Exception e) { sM("Wrong Syntax! Use as ::npc 1"); }}
[/quote]
if your not using delta then don’t use this one :3 its only ment for delta sources[/quote]

not really. the only diffrence is the send message command which can be changed easly

Read full topic
